description: US handbag maker Coach made several offers over the last few months, according to the FT, but Burberry rejected them all.
title: Burberry shares are jumping on talk of a £15 billion takeover
title_page: Burberry share price reacts to $20 billion Coach takeover offer - Business Insider
text:
Naomi Campbell in the Burberry Festive Campaign 2016, shot by Mario Testino. Burberry LONDON — Shares in luxury fashion brand Burberry are climbing on Monday morning after a report over the weekend said that US group Coach tried to buy the company.
The Financial Times reported on Sunday that Burberry rejected multiple takeover offers from Coach in recent months. A deal would have created a luxury goods giant worth over $20 billion (£15.7 billion). Coach is known for its handbags while Burberry is best known for its iconic check pattern and trench coats.
Both Burberry and Coach declined to comment to the FT and Burberry has not released a statement to the market on Monday morning. The FT says talks are no longer active.
